I decided to try the LANEIGE Lip Glowy Balm in Gummy Bear after seeing Jungkook from BTS rave about it - if it's good enough for him, I figured it was worth a shot!
What I liked:
The scent is lovely and not overpowering, and the Gummy Bear shade gives a nice sheer tint of color. The texture feels smooth going on, and it has a lightweight, glossy finish. The packaging is sleek and easy to toss in a bag.
What didn't work for me:
I have really dry lips and was hoping this would be a game-changer, but I've only used it a few times since purchasing. For my level of dryness, it seems like this product needs consistent, frequent application to make a real difference. Since I often forget to reapply lip products throughout the day, I haven't seen the hydration results I was hoping for.
For comparison, I find that Vaseline Lip Therapy works better for my sporadic usage habits and delivers more intensive moisture when I need it. This LANEIGE balm also doesn't have much taste to it (which some might prefer, but I personally like a hint of flavor).
Bottom line:
If you're consistent with lip care and looking for a pretty, lightweight balm with a subtle tint, this could work well for you. For severely dry lips with inconsistent application, you might need something more heavy-duty.

This powder delivers on its blurring promise - it really does create a smooth, airbrushed finish on the skin.
Dispenser concerns:
The push-down dispenser mechanism is a bit nerve-wracking to use. I never quite know how much product will come out when I press, which makes it tricky to avoid waste or getting too much powder at once. It takes some practice to get the feel for it.
I also can't see how much product remains in the compact, so I have no idea when I'll actually need a replacement. You're basically flying blind until it suddenly runs out.
The puff:
The included puff is wonderfully soft and fluffy, which feels nice on the skin. However, since I'm using this as a finishing powder over foundation, the puff picks up my foundation color pretty quickly. You'll likely want to wash it regularly or have a backup puff on hand.
Performance & portability:
No white cast, which is great (though full disclosure - I'm not very tanned, so those with deeper skin tones should test this). The compact is nicely sized for travel - small enough to slip into any bag without taking up much space.
Bottom line:
The blurring effect is fantastic and the compact size is convenient, but the dispensing system could use some improvement. If you can get past the learning curve with the dispenser, it's a solid finishing powder for touch-ups throughout the day.
